Recap: Brooke and Ridge continue their lip smooches in the office, but remind each other they do have a showing and they better get rolling. They speak of their engagement party and everybody except Rick seems to be on their side. Brooke fills Phoebe's head with years down the line of being her replacement. Nick tells Jackie that he has Harrison locked up, but he still has to talk to the other distributors. Jackie is still worried that he is over-extending. Mr. Chen surmises that selling to Nick makes him part of the vendetta against Eric Forrester, but a very rich man, so he signs.

Rick and Ridge have a heart to heart and Rick rubs it in that Ridge takes the blame. Ridge advises him to stop throwing all his resentment toward him, and start trying to make this company a success. Ridge tells Brooke that Rick is also afraid she will fall back into his evil spell, but they have nothing to worry about. Rick and Phoebe hit it off more and he loves her enthusiasm. Brooke drops in to see Nick, but is thwarted by Jackie and she's infuriated that Jackie won't let her see him. What is he up to? Jackie will only say that he will do anything it takes to win. Not seeing Brooke, Nick blurts out to his mother that the deal is done, they need to celebrate. Brooke asks what deal?
Transcript: Ridge: I could not keep my hands off of you.
Brooke: I know the feeling. I like the feeling. Working together with you like this, it excites you, I can tell.
Ridge: Can you?
Brooke: Mm-hmm.
Ridge: It excites you, too.
Brooke: Mm-hmm. But we have to remember --
Ridge: I know, I know. We've got a show bearing down on us here. I remember.
Brooke: Yeah, and the Forrester Originals --
Ridge: The most important showing of our life. I know.
Brooke: But it is good to be inspired.
Ridge: Yes.
Brooke: Oh, gosh, something else is important, though. Our engagement party. A party that your mother is working so hard on. All the way from Chicago, no less.
Ridge: Oh, please. It's not like she's Aunt Pam, laughing in the kitchen, making things. She just goes and calls the caterer.
Brooke: I want to get to that party on time. I don't want to be here doing what we should have done now.
Ridge: Then, let's finish. Let's finish.
Brooke: No, no, no, no. I'm talking about work. We need to finish work. Yes. Our engagement party. I mean, can you believe this? The whole family is finally behind us.
Ridge: Well, almost. Rick, you and me under the same roof didn't exactly have him jumping for joy.
Brooke: Okay, well, he did come from Paris, and he adores Paris. That was his domain. He had 200 people working for him that loved him. Try putting yourself in his shoes.
Ridge: Let's just hope he loves working for us as husband and wife.
Brooke: Husband and wife. I like the sound of that.
[Knocking at door]
Phoebe: I didn't mean to interrupt.
Ridge: Oh, Phoebe, come on in.
Phoebe: Hi. It's good to see everyone happy.
Brooke: Yeah.
Ridge: What's on your mind?
Phoebe: I -- you just wanted to talk to me?
Brooke: Oh, yes. Yes. Eric has some, you know, some sketches he needs you to see in his office.
Ridge: He does?
Brooke: Yes.
Ridge: He does. Yes, I remember. Okay. Good. Okay, thanks. Hey, did Storm or Donna happen say anything about Nick's reaction to us using the name Forrester?
Brooke: Actually, no. They didn't say anything.
Phoebe: Well, if Nick sued, wouldn't it just give us more publicity?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Nick: We've got the west coast distribution of Harrison's locked up. We got to nail down these other distributors before Forrester Originals debuts their collection.

Storm: Jackie might be right.
Nick: We met our goal.
Storm: Well, maybe you could explain it to me more clearly, Nick. Because right now, we're borrowing against debt for a company we know very little about.
Assistant: Mr. Chen is here to see you, sir.
Nick: Send him in. Mr. Chen, I appreciate you meeting with me.
Mr. Chen: I may be here, Mr. Marone, but you and I are a long way from any agreement.
[SCENE_BREAK]
[Announcer: The role of Rick Forrester is now being played by Kyle Lowder.]
Rick: Though I am back in L.A., rest assured, Forrester Originals will be in the European market. Absolutely. Good.
Ciara: Glad to be back in L.A.?
Rick: I am glad to be working with my father.
Ciara: Well, if you want, I can show you a few new hot spots you might like.
Rick: Turn.
Ridge: Hey, what do you think?
Rick: I love it. Thank you.

Ridge: Glad we'll have an opportunity to collaborate.
Rick: Maybe you're all excited and pumped up about this whole thing -- new company, new offices -- but I see it a bit differently.
Ridge: Okay, how do you see it?
Rick: I'm Eric Forrester, Jr. Forrester Creations mattered as much to me as anybody.
Ridge: And?
Rick: And I had to let half of my Forrester International employees go. The other half has no idea who Nick Marone is or what he's been up to. Those people were like family to me.
Ridge: Well, in a little while, you'll be able to go and hire them all back. Fine. You need somebody to be pissed at; I guess it might as well be me.

Rick: Do you not realize the damage you've caused? Jackie Marone is a respected businesswoman. Publicly humiliating her? My European colleagues were appalled. Personally, I don't think we're going to be able to overcome this P.R. nightmare that we're in. And for that, I do blame you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Assistant: Yes, Mrs. Marone?
Jackie: Alert me the moment that Nicky's meeting with Mr. Chen is over.
Assistant: Yes, ma'am.

Nick: I have two appraisals of your company. I'm prepared to pay 10% above the higher estimate.
Mr. Chen: You want my company in the worst way. Perhaps I should have my own appraisal done.
Nick: The deal expires the minute you walk out that door.
Mr. Chen: Do you have the figures? Something motivates you beyond the distribution business. Before I consider selling what has taken a lifetime to build, you must tell me. Why do you want it?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Phoebe: Nick's still trying to hurt the family, isn't he?

Brooke: That's nothing for you to worry about. This company and this family, we have a very bright future. And we're lucky to have you with us. And I can't model forever or be a spokesperson forever. When the time is right, I would like you to be the new face of Forrester Originals. You deserve it. You're gorgeous. You're intelligent. You're smart. You're loving. You're everything a person would want to be able to represent this company.
Phoebe: You don't know how much that means to me, Brooke.
Brooke: Well, you are an amazing young woman. You truly are. And some day, some lucky, deserving guy is going to fall head over heels for you.
Phoebe: I don't know.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ridge: So, I should have done nothing? Forget that Marone blackmailed us? Forget that Jackie trespassed in my mother's home? All that shouldn't matter?

Ridge: So you wait until Forrester Originals gets off the ground, you go back to Paris, you hire them all back, and your good name's restored. There we go.

Rick: Maybe my mom is better served if I stay here in L.A. You see, my mom and Nick were very happily married. But you, you didn't give a damn about that, did you? See, you hated to lose, your ego just couldn't take it, could it, Ridge? That's what this whole battle with Nick Marone is about. And that is why we lost Forrester Creations.

Ridge: If Brooke really wanted a life with Nick, there's nothing I could have done to come between them. Nick screwed up his marriage all on his own. So if you're worried about losing your legacy, fine. Welcome to the club. But if you really want to get it back, stop throwing all of your resentment towards me. And starting focusing on making this company a success.
Rick: And who's to say that Forrester Originals will be a success?
Ridge: Forrester Originals versus Forrester Creations, with Clarke "The Hack" Garrison? Who's the choice here?

Rick: Do you think that Nick Marone is just going to do nothing? And all anybody around here can think about is how much of a success we might be. But we have not crossed the finish line yet, and Nick Marone is going to do everything in his power to make sure we never cross it. You'd be well served to keep that in mind.
Rick: Hey, Mom.
Brooke: Honey?
Rick: I'm sorry.
Ridge: He's upset about losing the life he had in Paris, and he's taking it out on me.
Brooke: He gave up a lot.
Ridge: He's also worried about you falling back under my evil spell.
Brooke: Well, he'll see how happy you make me. But Rick is right about Nick. It would be a mistake to underestimate him.
Ridge: No, Nick's head is spinning. Once this collection takes the runway, and our distributors go crazy for it, Nick will be down for the count. Logan, we've got nothing to worry about. Nothing.

Nick: Which is your business.
